info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 27 at 9:22PM CDT until April 27 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN TUNICA...SOUTHWESTERN TATE...NORTHEASTERN QUITMAN AND NORTHERN PANOLA COUNTIES... At 922 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Crenshaw, or 13 miles southwest of Senatobia, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Senatobia, Sardis, Como, Crenshaw, Sledge, Strayhorn, Pleasant Grove, Little Texas, Askew, Looxahoma, Buxton, Savage, Crossroad, McGhee, Longtown, Sarah, Horatio, New Town, Cypress Corner and Bluff. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
